intro: Pinalia lineoligera, commonly known as the narrow-striated pinyon, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of Mexico. It is characterized by its small, needle-like leaves and produces cone-like structures that contain its seeds. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and human encroachment.
